item.title: Albanese expected to meet with world leaders at Pope Leo's inauguration
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Nationals call it quits on decades-long coalition with Liberals
item.description: Nationals leader David Littleproud has announced the minor party will not re-enter a coalition agreement with the Liberal Party, ending a decades long arrangement.

item.title: Liberals and Nationals consciously uncouple after long and fruitful marriage
item.description: For 102 years now (apart from a brief and steamy affair with Joh Bjelke Peterson in 1987) the country-based National Party has been married to the urbanite Liberal Party.

item.title: David Littleproud under pressure to reconcile with the Liberals
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Shadow ministry decision stalled as Liberals and Nationals negotiate on reunion
item.description: The Liberals and Nationals have taken their first step towards reconciliation, just two days after their bombshell break-up, with both party leaders delaying planned announcements about their respective frontbench line-ups.

item.title: Nationals leader David Littleproud 'relaxed' as leadership questions roil beneath him
item.description: Nationals leader David Littleproud says he doesn't care if he loses his job over his role in ending the Coalition, saying he stood up for his party and his colleagues.

item.title: Coalition gets back together after week-long split
item.description: The Liberal and National parties have struck a deal to reunify, a week after the Coalition's extraordinary split in the wake of a ruinous election defeat.

item.title: Federal politics: One Nation's Tyron Whitten wins sixth Senate seat in Western Australia — as it happened
item.description: The sixth WA Senate seat to be decided at the 2025 federal election has gone to One Nation's Tyron Whitten, inching in front of Labor's Deep Singh, according to the AEC.

item.title: Geraldine Brooks on her memoir Memorial Days and travelling to Flinders Island to do 'the work of grief'
item.description: Three years after the sudden death of her husband, author Geraldine Brooks retreated to Flinders Island to do the work of grief.

item.title: Pope Leo XIV criticises nationalist politics at Sunday mass
item.description: Pope Leo criticised the emergence of nationalist political movements around the globe on Sunday, calling them "unfortunate" — without naming a specific country or national leader.

item.title: Father and son takes on Ironman Australia in Cairns after surviving cycling crash
item.description: After surviving a horrific crash while cycling together six years ago, Travis and his son Brayden McKenzie made a promise to compete in an Ironman competition. This weekend that plan is coming to fruition.

item.title: Broken Hill teenager Molly Molloy selected for NASA program in Texas
item.description: Broken Hill teenager Molly Molloy is set for an out-of-this-world experience after being selected as one of only two Australians to join an international space education program in the US.

item.title: Reckless crocodile interactions spark calls for tougher penalties
item.description: A popular croc-spotting site in Far North Queensland will be monitored after multiple reports of illegal interactions with the reptiles.

item.title: North Adelaide's LIV Golf redevelopment to go ahead after controversial laws pass SA parliament
item.description: Laws that allow the South Australian government to redevelop the North Adelaide Golf Course and move the LIV Golf tournament into the city pass parliament.

item.title: Growing number of Australians are calling themselves YIMBYs
item.description: Australia's YIMBY movement is relatively new, but it is making an impact and each member has their own housing struggle spurring them on.

item.title: Rangers search for owner of pet snake left on Bundaberg footpath
item.description: A dog walker makes an unusual discovery in Queensland that sends wildlife rangers on a "very strange" mission.

item.title: Mildura's mysterious big boom has experts and residents searching for answers
item.description: Quake, sonic boom or something extraterrestrial? Experts are so far unable to determine the source of a short, loud sound that shook homes and startled residents in north-west Victoria.

item.title: Restless Dance Theatre takes the arts to the end of a hospital bed with The Lensical
item.description: A South Australian theatre group has devised a new show, The Lensical, that provides young long-term patients with a thrilling bedside spectacle.

item.title: 'Birdnesting' alternates parenting at the family home during separation. Does it work?
item.description: Couples ending their relationship are increasingly considering birdnesting, a co-parenting arrangement where children remain in the family home while parents alternate living there.

item.title: Betrayal of Trust
item.description: The ABC is undertaking a major investigation into Australia's childcare sector, revealing what actually goes on behind closed doors.

item.title: Outback astronomers lodge appeal against Hydrostor's $1b energy storage project
item.description: A tourism business has lodged an appeal against a decision to approve a nearly billion-dollar energy storage project outside Broken Hill, saying light and noise will impact its business.

item.title: Zero positives for Sussan Ley in the Coalition's net zero battle
item.description: The opposition leader faces a diabolical situation with the debate over whether the Coalition should abandon the 2050 net zero target.

item.title: Ashleigh Webb waits for ratification of Baltimore to Fastnet Rock record
item.description: The 35-year-old Australian, who swam the course in 4 hours and 57 minutes, says she didn't aim to break any records when she entered the water.

item.title: No Return: Australia's Missing Billions
item.description: Four Corners is the home of Australian investigative journalism.

item.title: Kaylee McKeown wins 100m backstroke gold at World Aquatics Championships
item.description: Kaylee McKeown unleashes a sensational swim to come from behind and claim the 100m backstroke gold medal at the World Swimming Championships in Singapore.

item.title: Annual inflation hits 2.1pc in June quarter, down from 2.4pc in March
item.description: The "trimmed mean" measure of inflation — the Reserve Bank's preferred measure of underlying inflation — has also declined.

item.title: How Alick Wickham helped introduce freestyle swimming to the world
item.description: An Australian race in 1901 helped bring the freestyle stroke to the world.

item.title: Coriolanus star Hazem Shammas on the futility of making art at a time of crisis
item.description: Shakespeare's Coriolanus has drawn parallels to Trump. But for its star Hazem Shammas, it has brought up the failures of the arts community in relation to the war in Gaza.

item.title: Darwin uni's inaugural TEDx event welcomes regional expertise to global stage
item.description: According to the Aussie experts gearing up for their first TED talk this weekend, storytelling is key — but breaking down a subject you understand so deeply, to share that knowledge with the world, comes with a whole lot of nerves.

item.title: Great desert skink emerges from desert sands
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: If the RBA cuts rates this week, expect property prices to rise (again)
item.description: When the RBA cuts rates, it drives property prices higher. What does it mean for housing affordability?

item.title: WA 2025 election report blames problems on WA Electoral Commission fundng shortfall
item.description: Long queues at polling stations and a shortage of ballot papers were some of the issues at WA's March state election — which an independent report says was in part caused by a lack of government funding to hire enough staff.

item.title: Anthony Ireland installed as Archbishop of Hobart, with shift in style likely after Julian Porteous
item.description: Tasmania has a new archbishop, among the first appointments made by Pope Leo — and his style is said to be quite different to his predecessor.

item.title: As bold economic reform ideas go, an 'imputed rent' tax on home owners has precedents
item.description: As industry leaders and the federal government prepare for next week's economic summit, two economists have started a national conversation by arguing that, to make Australia's tax system fairer, we should consider taxing home owner-occupancy. Here's what that means.

item.title: Influx of highly venomous sea snakes on Sunshine Coast shorelines
item.description: A snake catcher and venomous animal expert warn against touching the "mad rush of sea snakes" washing up on the Sunshine Coast.

item.title: CSL shares dive, dragging ASX down as biotech flags job cuts and flu spin-off — as it happened
item.description: Biotech giant CSL saw its share price tank on Tuesday, which dragged the ASX down. Look back on the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News markets blog.

item.title: Jerry Adler, star of The Sopranos and The Good Wife, dies aged 96
item.description: Adler starred as Tony Soprano's adviser Hesh Rabkin across all six seasons of The Sopranos and played law partner Howard Lyman in The Good Wife.

item.title: Outback grazier swims Catalina Channel in bid for Triple Crown of Open Water Swimming
item.description: An outback grazier completes the 32-kilometre Catalina Channel in his latest marathon swim after training in Broken Hill's pool and Menindee Lakes, devoid of waves or currents.

item.title: Outback amateur astronomer Trevor Barry immortalised in new book
item.description: Trevor Barry had no idea his discoveries would lead him to scientific publications and international recognition when he built his own observatory in his outback backyard.

item.title: Social media critical as northern Australia works to curb concerning high drowning rates
item.description: With northern Australia having the highest rates of drowning in the nation, authorities look to influencers, social media companies, and gender-specific messaging to reduce deaths around waterfalls.

item.title: King Charles, Prince William and the royals' love-hate relationship with Buckingham Palace
item.description: King Charles hasn't moved into Buckingham Palace and Prince William reportedly plans to live somewhere else as king. So what's wrong with Buckingham Palace and what will its future be if it's not the main residence of the royal family?

item.title: Audrey Jacob's 100yo 'murder' on the dance floor brought back to life
item.description: A century ago, a young woman shot her former fiancé dead in the middle of a crowded Perth ballroom, but was acquitted of murder by a jury. Now, a stage play is retelling the story of Audrey Jacob's astonishing defence.

item.title: Anti-immigration rallies held across Australia as clashes break out in Adelaide and Melbourne
item.description: Clashes break out at some of the anti-immigration rallies being held across the country, including in Melbourne, where police have used pepper spray.

item.title: Back to Bilo is an immigration story that needs to be told and retold
item.description: The Nadesalingam family's immigration nightmare has been transformed into a work of theatre that will have its world premiere at Brisbane Festival.

item.title: Mackenzie from Fangirls writer Yve Blake leads Bell Shakespeare's 2026 season
item.description: The mid-00s was the age of fallen kids TV stars like Lindsay Lohan and Amanda Bynes. It's now the setting of a riff on Shakespeare's Macbeth.

item.title: Runt by Craig Silvey comes to the stage in Belvoir St Theatre's 2026 season
item.description: Runt earned a slew of awards for younger readers and was turned into a movie. Ahead of the release of the sequel, a theatre adaptation is in the works.

item.title: Growing group of Labor MPs urge 2035 emissions target above Climate Authority's floor
item.description: A growing cross-factional group within Labor is privately urging for Australia's next major climate target to respect the advice of the Climate Change Authority, which will hand its opinion on a 2035 target to government any day.

item.title: Antarctic expeditioners join research project to help astronauts on space missions
item.description: Expeditioners at Australia's Antarctic stations are taking part in a research project to better understand the cognitive and physiological impacts of extended deployments — which can include actual "brain shrinkage".

item.title: Craig McLachlan withdraws from Cluedo stage show following backlash
item.description: Less than a week ago, Craig McLachlan was announced to play Colonel Mustard in the forthcoming national tour, making his return to the theatre after The Rocky Horror Show.

item.title: Cashrewards's abrupt closure leaves shoppers many unanswered questions. Here's what we know
item.description: Two and a half million Australians have signed up for this cashback app, which leaves them wondering what's next.

item.title: Does the damning planning report mean the end for Hobart's Macquarie Point stadium?
item.description: The Tasmanian Planning Commission described the Hobart stadium as a "singular, large, bulky monolith" with "optimism bias" in the government's cost-benefit figures. What does this mean for the stadium?

item.title: Woman's snake bite death in Katherine sparks warnings against complacency
item.description: Experts say snake bite victims may not even be aware their lives are in imminent danger after a woman was killed by a snake in Katherine earlier this month.

item.title: F1 Azerbaijan Grand Prix: Oscar Piastri crashes on lap one, Max Verstappen wins in Baku
item.description: Oscar Piastri's worst weekend of 2025 ended with a false start, then a lap one crash, but he retains a healthy championship lead after his teammate failed to capitalise.

item.title: Aussie brothers Jett and Hunter Lawrence win at SuperMotocross World Championship
item.description: Two brothers from the Sunshine Coast finish first and second in the SuperMotocross World Championship, taking home an eye-watering cash reward.

item.title: Super Netball's Sunshine Coast Lightning enters new Global Sports Fund Management Group ownership
item.description: Almost a decade after being co-founded by the Melbourne Storm and University of the Sunshine Coast, Super Netball's Lightning is entering a new era.

item.title: Moldovan authorities arrest 74 people over alleged Russia-backed election plot
item.description: The widespread raids came ahead of the country's parliamentary elections on Sunday, expected to determine whether the country will pursue closer ties with the European Union.

item.title: Italian police use tear gas against pro-Palestinian protesters demanding end to war in Gaza
item.description: Italy's right-wing government, led by Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, says it does not plan to recognise Palestine at this stage.

item.title: Artemis program on track to take astronauts around the Moon: NASA
item.description: NASA's first crewed flight in its Artemis program — a trip around the Moon and back — is on track for launch in April 2026 and could potentially be moved up to February, the space agency says.

item.title: Andrew Hastie taunted over claim that high immigration is making Australians 'strangers in our own home'
item.description: The home affairs minister says Andrew Hastie should name which visa classes he would cut after the shadow home affairs minister suggested "unsustainable" immigration was making Australians "feel like strangers in our own home".

item.title: Alexa Leary and Callum Simpson win gold medals for Australia at World Para Swimming Championships in Singapore
item.description: Alexa Leary's win in the final individual event of Wednesday night's action in Singapore bookended a golden night for Australia after Callum Simpson won gold in the first event of the evening.

item.title: Andrea James to lead Ilbijerri Theatre Company as artistic director Rachael Maza steps back
item.description: Andrea James will take the helm of Australia's oldest Indigenous theatre company Ilbijerri, as outgoing artistic director Rachael Maza steps back after almost 18 years.

item.title: Postal voting issues identified ahead of 2025 WA local government elections
item.description: Incorrect ballot papers are among several problems identified with postal voting packages sent out ahead next month's local government elections in WA.

item.title: Newcastle Ocean Baths the setting for new headphone theatre production, Meet Me at the Baths
item.description: A new headphone theatre production is set among the swimmers and sunbakers at a NSW city's much-loved ocean pool.

item.title: Health minister concedes tobacco black market has 'exploded'
item.description: Health Minister Mark Butler admits black market tobacco is now the single biggest threat to public health.

item.title: Detailed designs of new lyric theatre inspired by Canberra's natural landmarks revealed
item.description: Detailed designs show plans for the new 2,000-seat lyric theatre, inspired by Canberra's natural landmarks, which will host major musicals, ballets and operas.

item.title: Wool price soars as production crashes and Chinese demand lifts
item.description: Australian wool prices lifted sharply this week for a few reasons, including a shrinking amount of wool being produced.

item.title: Shellharbour Council proposes tiny home planning pathway in NSW first
item.description: Shellharbour Council approves a plan for a tiny homes planning pathway which it says could be adopted statewide, as owners face uncertainty around legal installation.

item.title: Aussie motorcyclist Daniel Sanders wins World Championship in record-breaking year
item.description: Daniel Sanders' world championship comes during a record-breaking run of form in the World Rally-Raid Championship.

item.title: NRL players, including Brisbane Broncos star Payne Haas, spruik crime-linked fashion line R4W Active
item.description: The grand final-bound Origin prop and at least three other NRL players are promoting a clothing brand linked to the Alameddine crime family, fuelling police concern the league has failed to stem the influence of organised crime.

item.title: Climate change is hitting the Northern Territory harder than most places in Australia
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Albanese invites Emirati retail giant Lulu Hypermarket to take on Coles and Woolworths
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has invited Emirati 'hypermarket' chain LuLu Group to set up shop on Australia's shores and take on supermarket giants Coles and Woolworths.

item.title: Tom Ballard's new show searches for the line between funny and offensive while pushing the comedy envelope
item.description: Comedian Tom Ballard is swapping a stand-up stage for a dramatic one as his new stage show asks, how do you remember a divisive figure?

item.title: Madagascar's President Andry Rajoelina dissolves government following deadly youth-led protests
item.description: Youth-led protests over water and power cuts in Madagascar lasted three days and were the largest the island had seen in years.

item.title: More sunscreens pulled from shelves over SPF concerns
item.description: Ten further sunscreens have either been pulled from shelves or "paused" from supply to retailers over concerns about their sun protection claims, the Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA) announces.

item.title: $50m fund for clean energy apprenticeships remains untouched
item.description: A $50 million fund to support students wanting to study clean energy trades is yet to pay out a single dollar, nearly a year and a half after it was funded in the budget.

item.title: Nicole Kidman files for divorce from Keith Urban after 19 years of marriage
item.description: The Oscar-winning actor files for divorce in a Nashville court a day after reports emerged of the couple's separation, with a source saying the decision to leave was Keith Urban's.

item.title: Former employees of sunscreen testing lab Princeton Consumer Research blow whistle on alleged questionable practices
item.description: Two former employees of a leading international testing laboratory used by major Australian sunscreen brands have blown the whistle on alleged questionable data and incorrect testing practices, amid ongoing concerns about whether consumers can trust the products they are relying on for sun protection.

item.title: Disability advocates call for rethink after Palmerston Hospital's hydrotherapy pool closes to external providers
item.description: Robyne Burridge lives with a disability that severely impacts her mobility, and hydrotherapy is vital. But she hasn't received that treatment in months after the NT government cut off public access to the only suitable local facility.

item.title: Max Verstappen has never won the F1 Singapore Grand Prix but has a chance as he chases Oscar Piastri and McLaren
item.description: Max Verstappen has won the previous two grands prix in Formula 1, but this weekend's race in Singapore is the only circuit on the calendar on which he has never triumphed.

item.title: One in five girls consider dropping athletics and swimming due to periods, new research shows
item.description: Research by Federation University has found 63 per cent of girls have missed training, and a third have missed competitions, because of period-related challenges in athletics and swimming.

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs sentenced to 50 months' prison after offering tearful apologies in court
item.description: A New York judge says the disgraced music mogul's violence, coercion and abuse had devastating consequences on his two former partners, and he was unconvinced that Combs would not reoffend.

item.title: Community saves endangered tropical sea turtle that washed up on Esperance beach
item.description: A community has sprung into action to nurse a juvenile tropical turtle back to health as wildlife carers question how it found its way to WA's south coast.

item.title: Outback businesses raise concerns about Services Australia's Centrepay reforms
item.description: Business owners worry major changes to a buy now, pay later system used by about 500,000 social security recipients will cause a raft of issues when it begins next month.

item.title: Vintage cars race on historic Lake Perkolilli track in Red Dust Revival
item.description: A dusty claypan in outback Western Australia is transformed back into a historic race track, as vintage car and motorcycle enthusiasts re-enact races held a century ago.

item.title: Trump deploys National Guard in city deeply scarred by military force
item.description: The National Guard was deployed to Chicago streets in 1968. It changed the city forever.

item.title: Sussan Ley cites trans offender case in argument for minimum jail terms for child exploitation crimes
item.description: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley raises the case of a trans child abuser as she seeks to pressure the Albanese government to create mandatory minimum jail terms for child exploitation offences.

item.title: Janine Vaughan's family call for billboard to be uncovered ahead of Bathurst 1000
item.description: With more than 200,000 people expected to attend this weekend's Bathurst 1000, the family of Janine Vaughan wants a billboard raising awareness about her disappearance uncovered.

item.title: Fresh and fragrant strawberry and cinnamon torte - ABC News
item.description: Sweet strawberries pair with a subtle cinnamon spice in this irresistible torte.

item.title: South Australia declared free from brown rugose fruit virus after more than a year
item.description: More than a year since South Australia's $230 million tomato and capsicum sector was plunged into turmoil by the first discovery of the tomato brown rugose fruit virus in Australia, the state has been declared free of the exotic disease.

item.title: Australian wins with a jaffle at World Porridge Making Championship
item.description: An oatmeal-filled jaffle made by a Melbourne food stylist and flavoured with Bundaberg Rum and bananas wins over judges in Scotland.

item.title: Trump is deploying more troops on home soil — here's where things stand
item.description: US President Donald Trump is ramping up efforts to deploy the National Guard in more cities across the country to combat what he claims is a "war from within". Here's a quick rundown on where Mr Trump has stationed troops — and which cities might be next.

item.title: Australia confident in batting at Women's Cricket World Cup, as Pakistan match approaches
item.description: Beth Mooney has predicted Australia's new approach to ODI cricket will pay off in the Women's Cricket World Cup, with a greater desire to take the game on.

item.title: Robin Williams's daughter begs fans to stop making AI content of her father
item.description: The daughter of the late actor Robin Williams has condemned AI-generated content featuring her father's likeness.

item.title: Sheffield Shield round one quick hits: Marnus Labuschagne enjoys timely century while Ashes Test hopefuls struggle
item.description: The Sheffield Shield is underway, with all eyes on the contenders for Australia's problematic opener spot. Here are five quick hits from the opening round of the season.

item.title: Saltwater crocodile found with mouth zip-tied shut in Adelaide River, sparking calls for stronger penalties
item.description: The discovery of a saltwater crocodile with its mouth bound shut by zip ties in a Darwin river has sparked outrage, with animal rights advocates calling for stronger wildlife protections.

item.title: Australian merino wool future positive after surging price restores grower confidence
item.description: Amid a run of price rises at Australian wool auctions, the next generation of growers say global demand and fresh confidence could mark a turning point for the fibre.

item.title: Australians are reading less than ever before. Here's how to read more books
item.description: Research shows Australians are reading fewer books than ever before. One writer shares her advice on how to make reading a daily habit.

item.title: Strava is suing Garmin for patent infringement. Here's what we know
item.description: Fitness app Strava and sports watchmaker Garmin usually go hand-in-hand, but the two fitness tech leaders are now in competition in a US lawsuit.

item.title: Three charged with murder and torture of Brisbane man Andrew Burow
item.description: Police will allege Andrew Burow endured a three to four-day ordeal which began after meeting with the accused in August.

item.title: With pressure from China to last, more metals facilities could put their hands up for a bailout
item.description: The bailout of another metals facility — this time in Queensland — is unlikely to be the last, with pressures on the sector driven by China to keep up for years.

item.title: Diamonds put foot down to beat South Africa in 67-40 victory
item.description: Australia flew out of the blocks to take a 2-0 lead in the series and extend their unbeaten record against South Africa to an extraordinary 48 wins.

item.title: Optus wears blame but government needs to explain how it handled early advice
item.description: The government is determined to avoid wearing any blame for Optus' failure but also needs to be transparent about how it handled early advice from the telco.

item.title: Pat Cummins's injury recovery continues ahead of Ashes, Mitchell Starc confident he can perform
item.description: Australia captain Pat Cummins is in serious doubt for the Ashes and has almost been ruled out of appearing in the first Test as he continues his recovery from a back injury.

item.title: Tony Burke suddenly keen to answer questions about Islamic State relatives
item.description: This week in Canberra, Tony Burke finally answered questions about the return of Islamic State relatives, Senate estimates turned into an episode of Utopia, and Andrew Hastie quit the frontbench.

item.title: Netball fights for recognition amid influx of women's sports
item.description: Netball Australia is taking elite-level netball to regional communities, hoping to showcase the sport's global impact and inspire the next generation of athletes.

item.title: Principals' power to ban aggressive parents from school grounds to extend to social media behaviour
item.description: Principals in Victoria already have the power to ban aggressive or violent parents from school grounds, but the state government is looking to apply the power to parents' behaviour on social media.

item.title: Australia 'still optimistic' Pat Cummins will play first Ashes Test against England
item.description: With the opening men's Ashes Test six weeks away, Australia coach Andrew McDonald is not willing to rule out Pat Cummins taking the field in Perth.

item.title: Brodie Kostecki sets qualifying record to snare Bathurst 1000 provisional pole
item.description: Brodie Kostecki looks a strong chance to become the third driver to claim three consecutive Bathurst 1000 poles after going fastest in Friday's qualifying session.

item.title: AI-generated images of missing 4yo Gus raise legal concerns about misinformation
item.description: The thought of a missing boy lost in the outback is indescribably harrowing — but what's almost as disturbing is the realisation that some on social media have seized on the disappearance of four-year-old Gus as an opportunity to spread misinformation.

item.title: Crispy pita bread, warm chickpeas and garlic yoghurt is an easy dinner - ABC News
item.description: This popular vegetarian Lebanese dish with crispy pita bread, warm chickpeas and a garlicky tahini yoghurt sauce is ready in 30 minutes.

item.title: Roaring jet boats to return to Victoria for first time in 15 years
item.description: From tractors to jet boats at Elmore, as Victoria prepares to host Australian series jet boat event in 2026.

item.title: Albanese government's BetStop scheme not working, former gambler says
item.description: Diehard Richmond fan "Tiger Shaun" says he's watched on in horror as gambling advertising and sponsorships have come to dominate football — and become a constant reminder of the addiction he has struggled with.

item.title: Kelpies for Kids fundraiser at Perth Royal Show raises nearly $50k for sick children
item.description: A working dog auction at the Perth Royal Show raises nearly $50,000 for charity Telethon to support sick children.

item.title: Australia's Diamonds defeat South Africa's Proteas 65-42 in third netball Test
item.description: Australia warms up for the eagerly anticipated Constellation Cup with a convincing 65-42 victory over South Africa in the third and final Test in Adelaide.

item.title: Ethan Strange stars as PM's XIII defeat Papua New Guinea 28-10
item.description: Ethan Strange underlines his case for Kangaroos selection and Trai Fuller scores four tries in the Prime Minister's XIII 28-10 defeat of Papua New Guinea.

item.title: Former tennis star Jelena Dokic grapples with complex grief after abusive father Damir's death
item.description: Jelena Dokic was abused by her father for years, with no tennis success enough to stop the beatings. She reveals the complex grief of losing a parent who showed no remorse.

item.title: Social media ban will further isolate regional and rural youth, LGBTIQA+ advocates say
item.description: LGBTIQA+ advocates are concerned the social media ban will have a significant impact on queer youth in regional and remote areas of Australia. They say there are not enough offline, physical supports for these teens to access when the ban comes into effect.

item.title: Brad Pettitt questions WA Labor's commitment to increasing Perth's tree canopy
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Pink Elephants report highlights care gaps for rural women experiencing miscarriages
item.description: Pregnancy loss is a lottery determined by location, according to a report that has sparked calls for the federal government to improve care for women who experience miscarriage in regional and rural communities.

item.title: What to do if your mortgage payments haven't gone down despite an RBA rate cut
item.description: You might assume home loan repayments will automatically reduce when an interest rate cut is passed on, but this isn’t always the case. Here's how to check.

item.title: Australia's Diamonds mindful they need to lift against New Zealand's Silver Ferns in Constellation Cup
item.description: Despite the comfortable series win over South Africa, Australia is mindful it will need to step up a gear in the Constellation Cup against New Zealand.

item.title: Australia call up Josh Philippe and Matt Kuhnemann for ODI against India
item.description: Josh Philippe is set to play his first ODI for Australia in four years, after Josh Inglis failed to recover from his calf strain in time for the series opener against India.

item.title: Madagascar military says it is seizing power after president flees country
item.description: The country's parliament voted to impeach President Andry Rajoelina after he fled the country in the face of growing opposition from soldiers and police.

item.title: Illegal fishing is awash in the Timor and Arafura seas. Discarded 'ghost nets' kill wildlife and destroy Australia's pristine coastline
item.description: Illegal fishing is ravaging the world's oceans of fish and shellfish but it is what is left behind that is creating a mess for governments worldwide and of Australia's most remote beaches.

item.title: Forensic imaging revealing hidden layers under Sidney Nolan's Ned Kelly paintings
item.description: Hidden figures and inscriptions are being discovered beneath some of Australia's most famous paintings as conservators use infrared technology to reveal details in Sidney Nolan's Ned Kelly series, unseen since the artist's own time.

item.title: Kangaroos coach Kevin Walters pledges no Queensland bias in Ashes series
item.description: Reece Walsh has built a compelling case for selection in the Kangaroos' starting line-up to face England, but coach Kevin Walters says he will not show favouritism towards the Maroons contingent in his squad.

item.title: Regional developers cash in on the global gaming industry
item.description: Better known for its gas and iron ore, the Pilbara hopes to add gaming to its list of local exports as internet access and technology improve.

item.title: Coroner makes rare public statement as NSW records most Indigenous deaths in custody in a year
item.description: NSW Coroner Teresa O'Sullivan's rare public comment on the "entrenched over-representation" of Indigenous prisoners as the state records the most ever in a single year, is welcomed by the grieving family member of a man who died in prison.

item.title: WA's Coolgardie council avoids suspension, with residents expressing frustration and relief over the saga
item.description: Coolgardie Shire leaders hope to rebuild trust among ratepayers after the local government minister announced the WA state government would not suspend the council.

item.title: England thrashes Latvia 5-0 to qualify for World Cup finals
item.description: Unbeaten in its qualifying matches, England reaches next year's World Cup finals following a dominant 5-0 defeat of Latvia.

item.title: Wildlife Photographer of the Year 2025 winners list: Spiders, frogs and fungi
item.description: An Australian photographer who took a unique shot of a skeletoniser caterpillar is among the winners.

item.title: AFL trade period, deadline day recap: Zach Merrett stuck at Essendon as Charlie Curnow and Christian Petracca find new homes
item.description: The clock runs out on deadline day of the AFL trade period, with Hawthorn failing to seal a deal for Zach Merrett, while the Swans hand over a raft of picks to clinch a move for Charlie Curnow.

item.title: Powerhouse misses opportunity to get Melbourne-bound drums of Sydney's Midnight Oil
item.description: Midnight Oil are Sydney rock royalty, but the drum kit that stuck with the band for more than 40 years is heading to a Melbourne music museum.

item.title: CCC investigation into former Townsville mayor Troy Thompson finished, but unreleased
item.description: A crime and corruption investigation into former Townsville mayor Troy Thompson has been finished, weeks away from a by-election he is expected to contest.

item.title: Conjoined boys born in PNG bound for Australia for medical treatment
item.description: The boys, who are only the second known case of conjoined twins born in PNG, are expected to come to Australia for medical treatment.

item.title: Hamas executes 'collaborators and lawbreakers' in graphic scenes in Gaza
item.description: Masked gunmen have carried out "extrajudicial executions" in the streets of Gaza City as an expert claims the terror group is trying to regain control of the destroyed enclave.

item.title: Michael J Fox talks about life with Parkinson's disease
item.description: The Back to the Future star has been candid about life with the degenerative neurological condition.

item.title: How long does it take to acclimatise to a new place when the weather is very different?
item.description: Do our bodies actually acclimatise when moving from one climate to another and can we do anything to smooth the transition?

item.title: Federal government puts states, territories on notice over failure to close the gap for Indigenous people
item.description: The federal Indigenous minister may impose penalties on states and territories that fail to meet critical targets for the National Agreement on Closing the Gap.

item.title: Australia's baby recession deepens, new ABS data says
item.description: The baby recession in Australia is deepening as cost of living pressures make the decision for people to have children less of a choice.

item.title: NSW bowler Sean Abbott subbed out of Sheffield Shield game after splitting webbing on hand
item.description: Sean Abbott becomes the latest Test hopeful to suffer an injury, ruled out of NSW's Sheffield Shield match after splitting the webbing on his bowling hand.

item.title: Three Australian men accused of killing Zivan Radmanovic in Bali could face death penalty
item.description: Indonesian police allege Zivan Radmanovic was killed when two Australian men stormed the villa, shooting him.

item.title: Residents in WA's north urged to prepare for cyclone season
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says it will no longer publish a cyclone outlook for WA's north, saying it was less reliable due to a changing climate.

item.title: AFL trade period quick hits: Zach Merrett's agent fumes, clubs feud over Callum Ah Chee deal and Charlie Curnow gets his move
item.description: The AFL trade period's deadline day delivered more drama than ever — with a manager blowing up and a Hawks star suggesting Essendon is 'Alcatraz' on a social media post.

item.title: Third day of renewed search for missing 4yo Gus wraps up amid extreme heat
item.description: More than 100 people, including from SA Police, the Australian Defence Force, and the State Emergency Services, have been walking about 20 kilometres per day in hot conditions during the renewed search, police say. The search concluded about midday on Thursday.

item.title: Nikon Small World photomicroscopy competition's top 15 images of 2025 capture our tiniest signs of life
item.description: Extreme close-ups of rice weevil, pollen in a spider's web and a geometer moth laying eggs are among this year's Nikon Small World competition entries from thousands of scientists and artists across the globe. Here are the judges' favourites.

item.title: Country GP crushed by vintage tractor in Denmark issues safety warning
item.description: What started as a routine day of chores for a country GP and his son became a life-or-death situation after he was crushed by a vintage tractor.

item.title: NSW Supreme Court finds protest law amendments invalid after Palestine Action Group challenge
item.description: The Palestine Action Group has won a NSW Supreme Court challenge against a law that limited protests near places of worship.

item.title: Calls for federal oversight of Indigenous deaths in custody rejected in the NT
item.description: Three decades after the landmark Royal Commission into Aboriginal Deaths in Custody, the Northern Territory parliament rejects a motion proposing the federal government establish an independent oversight body.

item.title: Female shearer sets world record by shearing 500 merino lambs in one day
item.description: Nikki Lyons's clippers started humming at 6am. Twelve hours later, she was a world record holder.

item.title: Hope at last for families as NSW backs inquiry into unsolved murders
item.description: The NSW Parliament has backed an inquiry into decades of unsolved murders and missing persons cases, following a campaign led by Illawarra families.

item.title: Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin to discuss Ukraine war at Budapest summit
item.description: Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin will meet face-to-face in Hungary to discuss ending Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine, the US president announces.

item.title: Temperatures across Australia to soar, threatening October records
item.description: Unseasonable temperatures have lasted along the eastern seaboard for weeks — which has Sydney, and possibly Brisbane, on track to observe their warmest October on record.

item.title: WWII shipwrecks a 'ticking time bomb' for Federated States of Micronesia
item.description: The Federated States of Micronesia's biggest tourism asset has become one of its largest threats, with as much as 22 million litres of oil from World War II shipwrecks slowly leaking into the ocean.

item.title: Expanded search for Gus ends as missing persons advocate speaks out
item.description: SA Police and ADF personnel have concluded a four-day renewed search for four-year-old Gus, as a missing persons advocate speaks out about the emotional impact of such cases on all families who have experienced the disappearance of a loved one.

item.title: Starmer criticises police decision to ban fans of Israel's Maccabi Tel Aviv from Aston Villa match
item.description: Fans of Israel's Maccabi Tel Aviv are banned from attending next month's Europa League match against Aston Villa in Birmingham over "public safety concerns".

item.title: Australian swimming star Ariarne Titmus says she lost 'fire in the belly' before shock retirement call
item.description: Ariarne Titmus has spoken publicly for the first time after abruptly retiring from professional swimming at just 25, revealing the reasons behind her decision.

item.title: Bears kill record number of people in Japan amid scores of attacks
item.description: At least seven people have been killed by bears in the country since April and many more have been injured as the hungry animals venture into human territory to find food.

item.title: 'No doubt' Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump will discuss critical minerals: Chalmers
item.description: Anthony Albanese will "no doubt" use a meeting with Donald Trump next week to discuss critical minerals, the treasurer says as he dismisses a call for Australia to "decouple" with China over rare earth materials.

item.title: Hamish McIntyre elected new president of National Farmers' Federation
item.description: Hamish McIntyre is named the new president of Australia's peak farmer representative body.

item.title: Cameron Green ruled out of Australia vs India ODI series, Marnus Labuschagne called into squad
item.description: Cameron Green has been ruled out of Australia's ODI series against India, just over a month out from the start of the Ashes series against England.

item.title: Ways to increase safety on a first date and red flags to watch for
item.description: Both people involved in a date are responsible for creating a safe environment, experts say.

item.title: Wayne Swan steps down as Labor president urging party to focus on membership boost
item.description: Labor party president Wayne Swan will step down next July and has warned the ALP must boost membership if it is to survive into the future.

item.title: Phillip Island lap record smashed by Marco Bezzecchi in MotoGP practice
item.description: In a stunning performance in perfect conditions on Friday, Marco Bezzecchi became the first MotoGP rider to go under 1.27 at the regional Victorian track.

item.title: AFLW Round 10: Port Adelaide Power defeat Hawthorn Hawks, West Coast Eagles down Geelong Cats
item.description: Port Adelaide defeats Hawthorn to record its fourth win of the AFLW season, while West Coast moves closer to a maiden finals appearance with victory over Geelong.

item.title: Adelaide United defeats Sydney FC 2-1, Brisbane downs Macarthur on A-League Men opening night
item.description: Adelaide United begins its season with a 2-1 win over Sydney, while Brisbane coach Michael Valkanis sees son Dimitri sent off in the Roar's 1-0 defeat of Macarthur.

item.title: Russia convicts 15 captured Ukrainian soldiers on terrorism charges
item.description: Fifteen captured Ukrainian soldiers from the Aidar battalion have been sentenced in a Russian court to up to 21 years in a penal colony.

item.title: Creating deepfakes has never been easier, so what should parents do?
item.description: Some parents may feel distressed and ill-equipped to tackle the issue of image-based abuse and deepfakes. This is what to watch out for.

item.title: Brad Battin under pressure as Liberal MPs weigh up second leadership spill in less than 12 months
item.description: The Victorian Liberals could be headed for their third leader in less than 12 months, with MPs internally dissatisfied with the performance of current leader Brad Battin.

item.title: Is the transfer of Australia's best young soccer players a good thing?
item.description: Are A-League soccer fans right to be frustrated when its best young players are sold off, or should they accept it is a 'selling' league?

item.title: A few simple questions reveal the games adults aren't brave enough to play
item.description: This game revealed how rarely we are vulnerable in front of our children, and in front of each other.

item.title: Tool's Maynard James Keenan on touring Australia, making wine and martial arts
item.description: The alt-metal band's frontman is a world-class multi-tasker. He tells us how he balances it all.

item.title: Greek-inspired lamb kebabs with olive potatoes baked in the oven - ABC News
item.description: The lamb is fuss-free and full of flavour. No barbecue needed — the oven takes care of everything.

item.title: From a Springsteen biopic to a doggy horror: here are the movies out in October
item.description: From the highly anticipated Bruce Springsteen biopic to a horror movie from the viewpoint of the family pup, here are the films filling up cinemas in October.

item.title: Minister flags compulsory voting in local government elections, 4-year terms amid low voter turnout
item.description: Voting in council elections could become mandatory in Western Australia if the turnout for this weekend's poll continues to plummet, the local government minister warns.

item.title: Trump tells Putin and Zelenskyy to ‘stop right now at the battle line’
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Max Verstappen claims sprint pole ahead of Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri at US F1 Grand Prix
item.description: Max Verstappen topples McLaren pair Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris to claim pole position for the sprint race at the United States Grand Prix.

item.title: Who is Prince Andrew? Why is he giving up his royal title?
item.description: The third-born child of Queen Elizabeth II will still be referred to as a prince and is expected to continue living in his Windsor mansion.

item.title: Israel identifies remains of 10th hostage handed over by Hamas as 76-year-old Eliyahu Margalit
item.description: Eliyahu Margalit's body was found after two bulldozers ploughed up pits in the earth in the city of Khan Younis.

item.title: Nottingham Forest sack manager Ange Postecoglou immediately after loss to Chelsea
item.description: Nottingham Forest sacked the winless manager moments after their 3-0 defeat by Chelsea on Saturday local time, which left the club 17th in the standings and on the brink of slipping into the relegation zone.

item.title: Prince Andrew's decision to give up his titles may have been quietly orchestrated by members of his own family
item.description: With the swirl of news around Prince Andrew this week, something had to be done; the question was whether he would do it himself or if his brother would be forced to show him the door.

item.title: Hard Quiz Kids: Who says trivia is just for grown-ups? It's time to put your thinking cap on
item.description: Hard Quiz Kids is here again, and we're gifting you a bunch of straightforward questions. Don't embarrass yourself.

item.title: After Ukraine, Finland hopes it won't be Putin's next target
item.description: Blasted into the bedrock, deep below the streets of Helsinki, these massive bunkers are currently used for recreation. Their primary function, however, is much more sinister: preparing for a Russian invasion.

item.title: China's 'special forces'-style tourists packing big itineraries in small budgets
item.description: Young Chinese tourists with limited time and money are travelling 'special forces'-style — inspired by the efficiency, endurance, and intensity of military units.

item.title: Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri crash in Formula 1 US Grand Prix sprint race
item.description: Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris have once again made contact with each other in a Formula 1 race, this time taking each other out at the sprint race of the US Grand Prix, just two weeks after their collision in Singapore.

item.title: Aussie Bird Count brings together students, photographers and nature-lovers
item.description: A primary school teacher is getting her students involved in a volunteer-led bird count, to gather a snapshot of birds across the country.

item.title: 'No Kings' protest crowds gather across the US against Donald Trump's leadership
item.description: Organisers say the rallies reflect frustration over the Trump administration's prosecutions of the president's perceived enemies, immigration raids and the sending of troops into US cities.

item.title: James Duckworth falls at Almaty Open semi-final stage against Daniil Medvedev
item.description: Australian seed-slayer James Duckworth has finally met his match in Almaty, where Daniil Medvedev dug deep to beat him in three sets.

item.title: US warns of 'imminent' Hamas attack on Palestinians in Gaza in potential ceasefire breach
item.description: The United States has received "credible reports" indicating an imminent violation by Hamas of the ceasefire with Israel in Gaza.

item.title: Nationals leader wants Barnaby Joyce to 'stay', amid rumour of One Nation defection
item.description: Announcing he would not re-contest his seat of New England for the Nationals, Barnaby Joyce cited an irreparable breakdown with his party leader David Littleproud. Mr Littleproud says he still wants Mr Joyce to stay.

item.title: Pakistan and Afghanistan agree to immediate ceasefire after peace talks in Doha
item.description: A week of fierce border clashes has seen the worst violence between the two countries since the Taliban seized power in Kabul in 2021.

item.title: Australian Para Triathlon mixed relay team seal silver at World Triathlon Championship Finals
item.description: Australia's para triathlon mixed relay team sealed a successful week by claiming a sensational silver medal on the final morning of the World Triathlon Championship Finals in Wollongong.

item.title: Mollie O'Callaghan crushes 200m short course world record as post-Titmus era begins
item.description: Mollie O'Callghan breaks the women's short course 200m freestyle world record on day two of the World Aquatics Swimming World Cup second leg in Illinois.

item.title: How Claire's decision to be 'one and done' was rocked by divorce
item.description: After a traumatic birth, followed by mental and physical health challenges, Claire was "one and done". But divorce made her think twice about her decision.

item.title: Tiger snake slides over passenger's foot during a drive on NSW far south coast
item.description: A passenger in a car has the fright of his life when a tiger snake slithers across his feet during a drive on the NSW far south coast.

item.title: North Adelaide golf course safeguards fall short, some Kaurna community members say
item.description: As the Malinauskas government proceeds with its $50 million North Adelaide golf course upgrade, some Kaurna elders are grappling with the prospect that the redevelopment could uncover Aboriginal remains.

item.title: Bruce Reynolds to remain City of Perth Lord Mayor as counting continues in WA local government elections
item.description: Bruce Reynolds has held onto the title of City of Perth Lord Mayor, while early figures from WA's local government elections show voter turnout is below what authorities hoped for.

item.title: Trent Dalton's Boy Swallows Universe wins Radio National's Top 100 Books of the 21st century
item.description: The results are in — Trent Dalton's Boy Swallows Universe has won Radio National's inaugural Top 100 Books of the 21st Century.

item.title: Pope Leo XIV canonises Papua New Guinea first Catholic saint Peter ToRot
item.description: Papua New Guinea has canonised its first saint after Pope Francis approved the canonisation of local preacher Peter ToRot.

item.title: Australia cruises to seven-wicket victory over India in rain-shortened ODI
item.description: Surviving a series of rain delays in Perth, Australia records a seven-wicket win over India in the first of three men's ODI matches.
